name: Vegan German Cheese Spaetzle
description: These vegan German cheese spaetzle are the ultimate comfort food! It's like the German version of Mac and Cheese made vegan.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup unsweetened almond or soy milk
7 oz smoked tofu, cut into cubes

recipeInstructions.text: First make the cashew cheese sauce: Place all ingredients into a food processor and process until smooth. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: First make the cashew cheese sauce: Place all ingredients into a food processor and process until smooth. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium pan, heat one tablespoon of olive oil and stir-fry the tofu cubes until they're crispy and lightly golden. Set aside and cook the leak together with one tablespoon of water for about 5 minutes in the same pan.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium pan, heat one tablespoon of olive oil and stir-fry the tofu cubes until they're crispy and lightly golden. Set aside and cook the leak together with one tablespoon of water for about 5 minutes in the same pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Then make the spaetzle: Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl and stir well with a wooden spoon (the dough should be pretty soft).
recipeInstructions.name: Then make the spaetzle: Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl and stir well with a wooden spoon (the dough should be pretty soft).

recipeInstructions.text: Fill the spaetzle dough into a potato ricer and press it into the boiling water (don't put it into the hot water, but just let the dough drop into the water). The spaetzle will be ready when they rise to the surface (this will take about 2-3 minutes). Skim and put aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan heat the cashew cheese sauce, add the leek, the tofu and gently stir in the spaetzle. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with fresh parsley.
